intro: Helixanthera valida, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is complemented by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
